translation.text: Maaroo, First Mehl, Dakhanee:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: Deep within the body-village is the fortress.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: The dwelling of the True Lord is within the city of the Tenth Gate.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਅਸਥਿਰੁ ਥਾਨੁ ਸਦਾ ਨਿਰਮਾਇਲੁ ਆਪੇ ਆਪੁ ਉਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧॥

translation.text: This place is permanent and forever immaculate. He Himself created it. ||1||

transliteration.text: asathir thān sadā niramāil āpē āp upāidā .1.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

translation.text: Within the fortress are balconies and bazaars.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

translation.text: He Himself takes care of His merchandise.

text: ਬਜਰ ਕਪਾਟ ਜੜੇ ਜੜਿ ਜਾਣੈ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੀ ਖੋਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੨॥

translation.text: The hard and heavy doors of the Tenth Gate are closed and locked. Through the Word of the Guru's Shabad, they are thrown open. ||2||

transliteration.text: bajar kapāt jarē jar jānai gur sabadī khōlāidā .2.

translation.text: Within the fortress is the cave, the home of the self.

text: ਦਸਵੈ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਲੇਖੁ ਅਪਾਰੀ ਆਪੇ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾਇਦਾ ॥੩॥

translation.text: In the Tenth Gate, the Primal Lord, the unknowable and infinite dwells; the unseen Lord reveals Himself. ||3||

transliteration.text: dasavai purakh alēkh apārī āpē alakh lakhāidā .3.

translation.text: Within the body of air, water and fire, the One Lord dwells.

text: ਬਲਦੀ ਜਲਿ ਨਿਵਰੈ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਤੇ ਆਪੇ ਜਲ ਨਿਧਿ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੪॥

translation.text: By His Grace, water puts out the burning fire; He Himself stores it up in the watery ocean. ||4||

transliteration.text: baladī jal nivarai kirapā tē āpē jal nidh pāidā .4.

translation.text: Creating the earth, He established it as the home of Dharma.

translation.text: Creating and destroying, He remains unattached.

text: ਪਵਣੈ ਖੇਲੁ ਕੀਆ ਸਭ ਥਾਈ ਕਲਾ ਖਿੰਚਿ ਢਾਹਾਇਦਾ ॥੫॥

translation.text: He stages the play of the breath everywhere. Withdrawing His power, He lets the beings crumble. ||5||

transliteration.text: pavanai khēl kīā sabh thāī kalā khinch dhāhāidā .5.

translation.text: Your gardener is the vast vegetation of nature.

translation.text: The wind blowing around is the chauree, the fly-brush, waving over You.

text: ਚੰਦੁ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਦੁਇ ਦੀਪਕ ਰਾਖੇ ਸਸਿ ਘਰਿ ਸੂਰੁ ਸਮਾਇਦਾ ॥੬॥

translation.text: The Lord placed the two lamps, the sun and the moon; the sun merges in the house of the moon. ||6||

transliteration.text: chand sūraj dui dīpak rākhē sas ghar sūr samāidā .6.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਰਵੈ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਵੈ ਹਰਿ ਰਸੁ ਚੋਗ ਚੁਗਾਇਦਾ ॥੭॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh intuitively sings the Glorious Praises of the Lord; he eats the food of the Lord's sublime essence. ||7||

transliteration.text: guramukh sahaj ravai gun gāvai har ras chōg chugāidā .7.

translation.text: The dazzling light glitters, although neither the moon nor the stars are shining;

translation.text: neither the sun's rays nor the lightning flashes across the sky.

text: ਅਕਥੀ ਕਥਉ ਚਿਹਨੁ ਨਹੀ ਕੋਈ ਪੂਰਿ ਰਹਿਆ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਇਦਾ ॥੮॥

translation.text: I describe the indescribable state, which has no sign, where the all-pervading Lord is still pleasing to the mind. ||8||

transliteration.text: akathī kathau chihan nahī kōī pūr rahiā man bhāidā .8.

translation.text: The rays of Divine Light have spread out their brilliant radiance.

translation.text: Having created the creation, the Merciful Lord Himself gazes upon it.

text: ਅਨਹਦ ਰੁਣ ਝੁਣਕਾਰੁ ਸਦਾ ਧੁਨਿ ਨਿਰਭਉ ਕੈ ਘਰਿ ਵਾਇਦਾ ॥੯॥

translation.text: The sweet, melodious, unstruck sound current vibrates continuously in the home of the fearless Lord. ||9||

transliteration.text: anahad run jhunakār sadā dhun nirabhau kai ghar vāidā .9.

text: ਸਭ ਤੇਰੀ ਤੂ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਾਤਾ ਦਰਿ ਸੋਹੈ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: All belong to You; to the Gurmukhs, You are known. Singing Your Praises, they look beautiful in Your Court. ||10||

transliteration.text: sabh tērī tū guramukh jātā dar sōhai gun gāidā .10.

translation.text: I know of no other at all.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਏਕੰਕਾਰੁ ਵਸੈ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਵੈ ਹਉਮੈ ਗਰਬੁ ਗਵਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: The One Universal Creator Lord dwells within, and is pleasing to the mind of those who banishe egotism and pride. ||11||

transliteration.text: ēkankār vasai man bhāvai haumai garab gavāidā .11.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

translation.text: I drink in the Ambrosial Nectar, given by the True Guru.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev

Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. translation.text: I do not know any other second or third.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਏਕੋ ਏਕੁ ਸੁ ਅਪਰ ਪਰੰਪਰੁ ਪਰਖਿ ਖਜਾਨੈ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: He is the One, Unique, Infinite and Endless Lord; He evaluates all beings and places some in His treasury. ||12||

transliteration.text: ēkō ēk s apar paranpar parakh khajānai pāidā .12.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

translation.text: Spiritual wisdom and meditation on the True Lord are deep and profound.

translation.text: No one knows Your expanse.

text: ਜੇਤੀ ਹੈ ਤੇਤੀ ਤੁਧੁ ਜਾਚੈ ਕਰਮਿ ਮਿਲੈ ਸੋ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: All that are, beg from You; You are attained only by Your Grace. ||13||

transliteration.text: jētī hai tētī tudh jāchai karam milai sō pāidā .13.

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

translation.text: You hold karma and Dharma in Your hands, O True Lord.

translation.text: O Independent Lord, Your treasures are inexhaustible.

text: ਤੂ ਦਇਆਲੁ ਕਿਰਪਾਲੁ ਸਦਾ ਪ੍ਰਭੁ ਆਪੇ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: You are forever kind and compassionate, God. You unite in Your Union. ||14||

melody.description: Maru Dakhani expresses feelings of truth and reality in an uncompromising and outspoken way, which is emphasised by the South Indian style of expression and taal.

translation.text: You Yourself see, and cause Yourself to be seen.

text: ਆਪੇ ਜੋੜਿ ਵਿਛੋੜੇ ਕਰਤਾ ਆਪੇ ਮਾਰਿ ਜੀਵਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: The Creator Himself unites and separates; He Himself kills and rejuvenates. ||15||

translation.text: As much as there is, is contained within You.

translation.text: You gaze upon Your creation, sitting within Your royal palace.

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਸਾਚੁ ਕਹੈ ਬੇਨੰਤੀ ਹਰਿ ਦਰਸਨਿ ਸੁਖੁ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੬॥੧॥੧੩॥

translation.text: Nanak offers this true prayer; gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Lord's Darshan, I have found peace. ||16||1||13||

transliteration.text: nānak sāch kahai bēnantī har darasan sukh pāidā .16.1.13.
